Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: To me, the Sixers are a five seed tops.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think they're going to the conference finals.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Bynum, obvious monster and the three point shooting, don't even-... [Jim bites his lip]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I bit my lip at lunch today.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Sucks. Anyway, I just don't see it. The Knicks are tough.The Nets are tough.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, the Nets are super tough. [Jim in pain from his lip]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Now I have this big bump in my lip that hurts. I hate it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The Hawks are terrible. They're always terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you need to think about it before you come with the... [Jim bites his lip again and pounds on table]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Whatever. It's not a big deal. You know I always tell my three year old, if this is the worst thing that's gonna happen...[Jim bites his lip again] You gotta be kidding me! Ok! Pam! That's it, I'm going home!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Good morning, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, sorry, Pam. Yikes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim's been spending a few days a week in Philly and I'm not gonna lie, it's been challenging. Yesterday, things took a turn for the worse. I found out Cece has lice. So I was up all night disinfecting every sheet, towel, toy, item of clothing in the entire house. I'm exhausted. But don't tell Jim. He has a huge meeting today, under a lot of pressure and he's doing it all for the family.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am meeting Dr. J today, otherwise known as Julius Irving, famed 76er and my own personal hero. But i have to be careful not to rub it in Pam's face because let's be honest, how would I feel if I was at home stuck with the kids while she was go carting with John Stamos.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [talking on phone] You sound tired. Everything ok?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great. Everything's great. Hey are you nervous about your big meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uhh, a little bit. It's a lot of pressure, you know, but that's what I signed up for right?

Quote.Speaker: Worker
Quote.Text: Jim, limo's here.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, you know what, I gotta hop off because my, uh, taxi is here to take me to the meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, call me later!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Good luck!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Love you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Love you too. Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: How you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Alright. I mean, it's what you want, so...

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: It's how it has to be.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I know, I know. It's just hard.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Me and Val were going nowhere and if I'm gonna be working in Philly, I'm gonna need my freedom. So, I convinced Val to breakup with me. Here's how you do it. You say, "What are you gonna do, breakup with me?" Like it's a joke, and then you gain a lot of weight.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'll never be sorry, not for a moment of it.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Me neither. Come here. [she hugs Darryl, and Darryl smiles behind her back]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey Meredith, I need your supplier requests today.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Jeez H. in the morning. Will you stop your nagging already? No wonder Jim left you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He didn't leave me. He just went part time. [Meredith scratches her head vigorously] Can you just fill out the form please?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sure she's just confused. People scratch their heads when they're confused. Not always like an ape, the way Meredith just did, but it happens.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hurry up already.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [checking Meredith's head] Trust me, I know what I'm doing. Between the foster homes and the orphanage, I had lice 22 times.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Holy wow, that's a big one. Alright, pencils down everyone, we got lice!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh God, Meredith, lice? Did you not sign a pledge to shower?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? Lice? Oh my god. Lock the doors, we are on full quarantine.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, relax. It's just lice. Maybe, possibly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just lice Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Of all of the vermin in God's great green kingdom, lice are the ones I detest the most. My first day of school, I had lice, and no one would play with me. For 15 years, they called me freak and four eyes and sci-fi nerd and girl puncher. All because I had lice when I was 7.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Make way, nope, inspect me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, this is the cleanest scalp I've ever seen. You are all clear.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Should be. I use lice shampoo every morning. [Dwight starts spraying everyone with disinfectant]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Stop that!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Next!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [getting her head checked] Geez Meredith, you know, this is an office not one of your bean bag orgies.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Alright, let's give her a break. We don't know for sure this is Meredith's fault.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Pam, really? Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, what do you want? I know who I am. Nobody's taken Meredith Palmer to the opera to meet the queen.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Lice. More lice. [Angela shrieks in disgust] Angela has lice.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ew! Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [checking Stanley's head] Ooh yabber, lice!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [checking Pam's head] Yikers, lice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No! How? I'm so clean!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [checking Oscar's head] Oh yeah, big time lice.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I wash my hands at least six times a day. Toilet seat covers? Yes, thank you, even when I pee. Apparently, none of that is protection enough. Not when it comes to Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What are you wearing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a Hazmat suit. That stands for hazaderous materials men's suit wearing. If you rent more than four times a year, it just makes sense to buy. Is there anyone else here that is lice free? [Phyllis, Kevin, Darryl. and Nellie raise their hands] Excellent. Do you have your own hazmat suits?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Renters. Ok, I'm gonna need you to gather your belongings, retreat to the warehouse, conduct your business there until the infected have been deloused. Let's get going. I'm gonna stay here and fight. If you don't hear from me by lunch, call me. I might want lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Alright, we're going down to my warehouse, that means we're playing by my rules. No messing with the baler and be cool in front of me and Val. We just broke up.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You got dumped?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah, she ended things.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Breakups are the worst. The only thing that got me through mine are large amounts of shepard's pie and Brandy. The singer, not the drink.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Here man. [Kevin hands Daryll some chocolate] You need that more than me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Thanks, man.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah [kisses Darryl on the cheek]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Guys, I think we should all ease up on Meredith. This has got to be hard for her.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, no no no no no. I have not yet begun to shame.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's it. I'm getting my stuff. I'm leaving for the day.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No! Stanley! If you leave now then you'll get it in your car and then you'll get it in your house! [Erin jumps on Stanley's back]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Get off me!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm trying to save you from yourself!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Alright, I'll stay! There's a pencil broken in my rolls.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe it was Meredith. Maybe she brought in lice that are totally different than the lice that i got from Cece. So let's not jump to the simplest conclusion that she got her lice from me. That is how wars get started. Fine, I'll tell her it was me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh man, that's fresh squeezed. And, uh are all the snacks complimentary?

Quote.Speaker: Limo Driver
Quote.Text: Yeah, take some home if you want.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh no, no, no. That's ok. [Jim shoves some snacks in his pocket as he gets out of limo] Um I'm sorry, is this the conference center?

Quote.Speaker: Limo Driver
Quote.Text: No, Mr. Irving called. Said he'd rather meet you at his private court.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You gotta be kidding me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Meredith I need to tell you something.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [shaving her own head] Yes, Pam what do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my God, Meredith what are you doing!?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Baking a cake, what does it look like I'm doing? Getting rid of the lice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh stop! I am so sorry!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Oh, can you hold that thought? That's my wax. You know, I think these critters migrated from down south. What were you saying?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Nothing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am going to tell her, but now is clearly not the time. I will buy her a wig, we'll have a few laughs. There's a right way to do this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Scalp leeches, skull vampires, follicle gypsies, hair lawyers. One thing is clear, it's kill or be killed!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, no. It's more of a nuisance really. It's not that big a deal. So, I collected your hats and your coats...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: To be burned!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: To be washed.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What do we do about our heads?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna lie. Lye!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: No, all we need is mayonnaise.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: She's right, it works. I would imagine.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes, it helps to suffrocate the little buddies and it's a really healthy alternative to the chemicals found in most lice shampoos.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I can appreciate that. I also only eat local, organic produce.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [walks in conference room] Shaboom! How do you like me now!?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Take a picture. It will last longer.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We don't want it to last longer. It's horrible.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Bald people make me sick.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, everybody pile on Meredith. But I'm the only one with the balls to show them lice who's boss.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ok, nobody panic. If everybody just follows my instructions, then nobody else needs to end up bald. Not that it looks bad, Meredith. It looks...It looks awesome. You look like a baby who suddenly aged 50 years. A cute baby, but something sucked the life force out of it. I'm so sorry. We need mayonnaise! We need it now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! Uh, uh I'll go.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay. Oh, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're a saint, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, no, it's not a big deal, please. No. Um, Meredith can I get you something special while I'm at the store, candy, or...or one of those stylish turbans?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thanks Pam! I'll take a pack of Nicorette gum and a pack of Kools.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's talk pubes, people.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Hey, Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, hey Val.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, that was tragic, Oh, that was like a car crash. I couldn't look away. You two clearly still have feelings for each other.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's gonna make you feel better, big guy?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: When I was a kid, my grandmother used to make me chocolate cake when I wasn't feeling good. She's not around to do that anymore. I'm sorry, I just need a moment to myself just to clear my head.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Aw, poor Darryl. I can't bear to see him suffer like this.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think he needs some hugs, and maybe some chocolate cake.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mmm, this won't help him, it's a muffin, not cake.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Listen, let's try and get Darryl the one thing in the world he clearly wants and needs the most.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: An Escalade.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Or what's her name.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Val.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Let's get Darryl Val.

Quote.Speaker: Julius Irving
Quote.Text: I hope you don't mind me bringing you out here. I can't get my knees under a desk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me? I can literally scalp tickets to this.

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: Well, do you think you can sink one from deep?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Listen, I don't mean to intimidate you, but I did play a little high school ball.

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: Okay. [Jim shoots the basket and it goes in] Wow, Halpert's got game.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. [Jim's phone rings] Oh, sorry. I'm so sorry. It's my wife, can I take this?

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: It's your wife? You better take it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right! [Jim laughs as he answers the phone] Hey, what's up? Everything ok?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, no everything's great! Um, I was just calling to see how the meeting went.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's still happening right now actually, so uh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He's really making you work for it, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, it is very stressful. You sure everything's okay?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Great. I am killing it over here. [drops mayonnaise on the ground] Jim, I gotta go.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, bye. [Jim turns back to Julius] So sorry about that.

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: No problem. Hey Jim, what size do you wear, man? I got a pair of japanese Nikes with your name on them. What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [handing out mayonnaise jars] Once it's all over your head, just leavr it there for four hours. That will be enough time for the lice to fall asleep, suffrocate, and then pass away.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh sure, and when you're ready to get serious, come to me to get it done right. [Dwight holds up a pair of scissors]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Put those away before you hurt yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [swings the scissors around and puts them into his pocket, putting a hole in his Hazmat suit] Oh God, oh no. No. No. No! No! No! No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay, it's easier with a buddy, so everybody pair up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar, do you want to be my partner?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah, sure. I'd love to..

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, mayo buddy, five dollar tip, you unclog my ears. Okay?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, Creed, I'm so sorry. I'm...I'm already partners with Pete, right Pete?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah. We promised each other if we ever got lice, we'd buddy up. Sorry, man.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Creed, wanna be my buddy?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Oh God. Stuck with the weirdo.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Angela is slapping mayo on Oscar's head] Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You don't want bugs. You know? Who knows where those bugs will end up?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [putting mayo on Stanley's head] You're getting a bargain. I ain't got no hair no more.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [putting mayo on Creed's head] Creed, I'm all done. My turn.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, Pam. It looks a little messy.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, wait.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: [putting mayo on Erin's head] How's that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I feel it working. [Erin and Pete playing around with the mayo] Eiffel tower!

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, we don't want to pry but we heard you broke up with Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's true.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: We think you made a big, big mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Big mistake.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Quite enormous.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: He's a real catch and you should take him back.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Ok, thank you. Is that all?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No. No, that is not all. Let me tell you what real life is like. The men dry up, and the nights get lonely. The only calls on your machine are for collection agencies about that pair of motorcycle boots you never even wore. You stalk your old high school boyfriend online, go to his daughter's soccer games, and make a scene. You buy a diamond ring for yourself, wear it on your right hand, and tell yourself, you're all you need. One day, you're alone, tired. At your feet, a dying bird. But where did it come from? Why did you kill it? Is it because in some strange way it is you?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Thank you all for your concern, but I'm gonna have to ask you to leave, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So does this mean you're gonna take Darryl back?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, then, what do you say to you and me hitting the town? 'Cause I'm free, literally forever.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Yeah, Kevin asked me out. I was kinda feeling good about reentering the dating pool, but then Kevin asked me out. Thought I might trade up to a new level of man. Then Kevin asked me out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [phone rings] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: [on speaker phone] Hi, honey, it's mom. Look, Cece's school just called. She still has lice.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What, no. That can't...I don't...

Quote.Speaker: Helene
Quote.Text: Now, don't worry, don't worry. I'm on my way to pick her up, but you might have lice too. You know, lice can be tricky. Sometimes lice, like...[Pam hangs up phone]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Shave her head. Shave her head!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [everyone yelling at Pam]You guys, I am so sorry! It's just been so chaotic with Jim gone, that...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah yeah, Princess Fancypants let Jane 12-pack over here take the fall.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [talking through the loud speaker] She's right Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is there a volume knob on that thing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah there's a volume knob on that thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Meredith, I am so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, a lot of good your sorrys are doing her now, Pam. She's a monster.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I meant to say something earlier. I just...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Just? Just what? Just forgot?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Who's the one who didn't bring lice into the office? Meredith. Sure I gave everybody pink eye once, and my ex keyed a few of their cars, and yeah I BMed in the shredder on New Years. But I didn't bring the lice in. That was all Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention, people of the office. You have exactly 60 secondes to evacutate the bull pen. At that time, I will be tossing this powerful insecticidal grenade, which contains piperonyl butoxide, as well as...[Dwight drops the grenade and it goes off inside Andy's office]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dwight, are you okay!?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa. Hypertoxide has a mild hallucigenic effect, but I don't think it's kicked in yet. I'm gonna count down from ten. Nine, yellow, cold, sad, purple. [Dwight collapses]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wow. He got to purple.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [Angela rinsing Oscar's hair, and she bumps his head] Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're waterboarding me!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oops.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [shoving large amounts of bubble wrap into the baler, as a warehouse worker passes] No, this is fine. We are allowed to do this. This is okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You're up.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'm kinda sad to see this baby go.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You do kinda look like Elvis, but we should probably wash all the dead lice out.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay. Okay. [rinsing Pete's hair out] Is that too cold?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: No, it actually feels kinda nice.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I wonder what happened over there. I've been sitting here the whole time. [as the baler crushes the bubble wrap, making loud noises]

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: Let's give it a shot. Let's make it work.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Oh, no. I mean, I want to, I just...I don't want to force you into something you don't want to do.

Quote.Speaker: Val
Quote.Text: You're not. I believe in us.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: But... [Val kisses Darryl]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm back together with Val. Yay...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I had a pretty good day today. Not everything went exactly according to plan, but lice if you are watching, I am ready for you anytime, anywhere. [Dwight gets into his car and another insecticidal grenade goes off]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey, did Erin already take off?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I guess so.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: You're Kareem, coming to help.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm Kareem. That makes total sense. I'm Kareem. You're Dr. J. Just sounds weird to say out loud.

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: And it went like this. [Jim's phone starts ringing]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And that's all?

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No one will believe this back home, but that's okay. Let me show you how it's done.

Quote.Speaker: Julius
Quote.Text: Yeah, you show me how.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Jim's phone goes to voicemail] This is Jim Halpert, leave a message.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey honey, it's me. Just trying to catch you before going home. Um, oh, well just give me a call whenever. Hope your day got better. Love you.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, what you doing right now?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna go home. My mom's been watching the kids all day.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Let her stay another hour. Let's go get a beer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really? A beer sounds incredible right now.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No duh. Let's go. You're buying.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Meredith, I am so sorry about today.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Forget about it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just did not realize how hard it was gonna be without Jim. I mean, I really respect you for being a single mom all these years. It whipped my ass in half a week. I have to say, there are not a lot of people who could pull off a shaved head, but you are rocking it.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Right. I got the bartender's phone number when you were in the john. I'm gonna take that freak to bone town before the night is over.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Get it, girl!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Pam and Meredith singing karaoke] This one's for all you ladies out there.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [starts singing] I come...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not yet.

Quote.Speaker: Both
Quote.Text: [singing] I come home in the middle of the night. My mother says when you gonna live your life right? Oh Mother dear, we're not the fortunate ones. And girls, they want to have fun. Oh girls just want to have fun.
